frameDefinitions: A Proprietor owns or runs a Business which provides a Product (which may be goods or services).
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
This frame concerns permanent organizations (the Institutions) that are intended to help members of the Target_group in a particular Domain with a Service_action.
The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.
Two (or more) people (the Interlocutors, also encodable as Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2) talk to one another.
An Agent makes use of a Means (either an action or a (system of) entities standing in for the action) in order to achieve a Purpose.
frameExamples: The consumer electronics <t>company</t> Apple has exploded with popularity in recent years.
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
The Red Cross Tracing and Message Service is a <t>service</t> for finding and reuniting families separated by war and disaster.
These groups are known to have carried out attacks on international coalition forces <t>operating</t> in Afghanistan.
I would rather <t>discuss</t> politics with anyone but him.
The primary <t>means</t> of gas detection is mass spectroscopy .
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Business</fen> identifies the company or establishment. This may be the target itself or the <fen>Business_Name</fen> if it is an appositive not set off with commas (i.e. restrictive):
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> in which the business is located.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
A permanent organization with a socially important purpose.
The concern of the <fen>Institution</fen>-- broadly speaking, the aspect of society that they affect.
The members of the public whom the <fen>Institution</fen> is intended to serve.
The action performed or enabled by the <fen>Institution</fen> for the <fen>Target_group</fen>.
The <fen>Force</fen> carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation.
The <fen>Area</fen> in which the <fen>Military</fen> is conducting operations.
The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes.
The <fen>Goal</fen> of the operation.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the operations are carried out.
The location of the operation.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>.  Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group.  It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>).  Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Interlocutors</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Interlocutors</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Discussion frame, it is possible for the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.

<fen>Topic</fen> expresses the subject that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> are trying to come to some agreement about.  It may refer, for example, to an undesirable issue that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> want to have the proper response to, or it may refer more directly to an unresolved question.
The time at which the discussion takes place.
The location at which a discussion takes place.
The Agent uses the Means to acheive a Purpose.
The action performed by the Agent.
The goal or purpose of the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Means</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.
At one emergency <fex>financial</fex> <fex>service</fex>, I double-checked people's math to make sure they weren't blowing the budget.
PG & E was the electric service <fex>for much of the West Coast</fex>.
Reach Out ! is a service <fex>for helping young Australians through tough times</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> died while carrying out counter-IED operations.
Operations <fex>against Afghanistan</fex> continue to be carried out.
He was captured in a covert <fex>arrest</fex> operation carried out by an elite group of highly-trained Marines.
This sort of operation should only be conducted <fex>in open areas</fex>.
<fex>The President</fex> conferred with his top advisor.
The President debated <fex>with his top advisor</fex>.
(1) <fex>The President and his advisor</fex> discussed the Venezuelan situation briefly before the summit.
The President and his top advisors discussed <fex>the scandal</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the participants discussed taking down the last trade barriers without consensus.
We just conferred for a couple of hours <fex>up in her room</fex>.
